metadata.title: golang: cmd/cgo: Arbitrary code execution triggered by linker flags (important)
metadata.description:
DOCUMENTATION: A flaw was found in golang. The go command may execute arbitrary code at build time when using cgo. This can occur when running "go get" on a malicious module, or when running any other command which builds untrusted code. This can be triggered by linker flags, specified via a "#cgo LDFLAGS" directive. Flags containing embedded spaces are mishandled, allowing disallowed flags to be smuggled through the LDFLAGS sanitization by including them in the argument of another flag. This only affects usage of the gccgo compiler. 
            STATEMENT: This vulnerability is only applicable to customer use of the GCCGO compiler and not any pre-compiled golang binaries shipped by Red Hat.

criterions.comment: golang is signed with Red Hat redhatrelease2 key
golang-src is signed with Red Hat redhatrelease2 key
golang-bin is signed with Red Hat redhatrelease2 key
Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7 is installed
Red Hat Enterprise Linux must be installed
